intro: Bastardia guayquilensis, commonly known as the Guayquil bastardia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, which helps it conserve water. Bastardia guayquilensis is often found in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in full sun exposure.
